answerText: liquid-liquid extraction [or solvent extraction; or partitioning][10] Because no two solvents are completely immiscible, one typically uses an anhydrous inorganic salt as drying agent before evaporating the second solvent. A common drying agent is this element's sulfate, also known as Epsom salt.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2014 | Editors Round 2 | 6 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer the following a separation process used in chemical engineering, for 10 points each: [10] In the lab, this process is typically performed with a separatory funnel and pulls a solute from one solvent to another, where the solvents are not miscible.
